properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a CustomPropertyCollection to verify the connection between the add-in and Word before performing operations on custom document properties.

properties.name: items
properties.description: Gets the loaded child items in this collection.

examples.description: Retrieve and display all custom document properties including their names, types, and values from a Word document.

methods.name: add
methods.description: Creates a new or sets an existing custom property.

params.name: key
params.description: The custom property's key, which is case-insensitive.

examples.description: Add custom properties to a Word document with specified names and values of different types (numeric and string).

methods.name: deleteAll
methods.description: Deletes all custom properties in this collection.

examples.description: Delete all custom properties from the current document

methods.name: getCount
methods.description: Gets the count of custom properties.

examples.description: Check how many custom properties exist in the document and display the count in the console.

methods.name: getItem
methods.description: Gets a custom property object by its key, which is case-insensitive. Throws an ItemNotFound error if the custom property doesn't exist.

params.name: key
params.description: The key that identifies the custom property object.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the value of an existing custom property named "ProjectCode" from the document

methods.name: getItemOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets a custom property object by its key, which is case-insensitive. If the custom property doesn't exist, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see [OrNullObject methods and properties](/en-us/office/dev/add-ins/develop/application-specific-api-model#ornullobject-methods-and-properties).

params.name: key
params.description: The key that identifies the custom property object.

examples.description: Check if a custom property named "ProjectCode" exists in the document and display its value, or show a message if it doesn't exist.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and display all custom document properties including their keys and values from the current Word document.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.CustomPropertyCollection object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.CustomPropertyCollectionData) that contains an "items" array with shallow copies of any loaded properties from the collection's items.

examples.description: Serialize custom document properties to JSON format for logging or external storage

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track custom properties collection to safely access and modify custom properties across multiple sync calls without getting InvalidObjectPath errors

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Load custom properties, read their values, then untrack the collection to free memory after processing is complete.
